snippet: The Swiss drug companies were ordered to pay a total of $250 million for trying to keep doctors from prescribing a relatively inexpensive eye treatment.
abstract: Italian antitrust authorities say they fined Swiss drug companies Novartis and Roche Holdings total of $250 million for colluding to keep doctors from prescribing relatively inexpensive eye treatment Avastin in favor of more expensive drug.
lead_paragraph: The Swiss drug companies were ordered to pay a total of $250 million for trying to keep doctors from prescribing a relatively inexpensive eye treatment.

headline.main: Italy Fines Novartis and Roche in Collusion Case
headline.print_headline: 2 Pharmaceutical Makers Fined for Undermining a Rival’s Drug
